column4: generally, packages get held back to prevent unexpected kernel updates. So, that's why linux-image-generic is getting held back

You're going to store all the unallocated space, which is wasteful and time-consuming, both on backup and restore (as I'm sure you're aware), and you can't really get around it by gzipping either since the unalloc'd space isn't guaranteed to be zero'd

yea but like zykotick9 said we might disagree cause I feel 40GB out of 1000gb is nothing to be able to say. Oh my computer took a crap well let me boot a live-usb and run one command and boom back to working
fair enough. and I guess my use case is a little strange, since I usually wind up doing that over a network...
